Description: Pottery jar made of straw tempered Nile silt, with flat base, globular body, low neck and rolled rim, coated with a reddish wash or self-slip. Several fire clouds on body.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna (London, 1911), p. 18, pl. xxxv.45a This pot is Rough ware R44m in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery. Marked H47 on side.
